column4: I have made my own distro based off ubuntu 7.10. when you run the test iso, ubiquity seems to act funny. if you choose a language other than english to install with, then after install you get the error "language failed with exit code 127". However, the language is installed and works, just I can't figure out why the error pops up. What does it mean?
if there is an error then you must not have installed something correctly.
maybe if you could tell us a bit more about the problem.....
my distro is very similar to ubuntu, just basically some different software and settings. but this is an ubiquity problem
what else do you wanna know?
i wasnt sure how specific to be initially
why dont you give a shot at searching the specific errors you see popping up in google
done already. no results of any use.
the error i get is what i said, its not more specific than that
thats all it says, but it still works
if you knew anyway to make ubiquity shut up with the errors, that would solve the problem
the only problem is the error, it doesnt actually cause anything elser
okay wanna join the ubuntu installer channel and we can talk there about this? less traffic there, so it will be easier
so you wanna go to the #ubuntu-installer channel?

i figured out what was causing it, which is why im asking this new question. i had added a special folder in an effort to make the ubiquity release notes change, and according to the syslog was causing the problem (i think)
